title: Devers Hits First Giants Homer Against Former Team Red Sox
snippets: Rafael Devers' first home run as a Giant came against his former teammates in Boston on Saturday, but he said it was "nothing more special than any other home run that I've hit."
Watch as San Francisco Giants slugger Rafael Devers punishes his former team, the Boston Red Sox, with an opposite-field two-run homer on Saturday.

Rafael Devers crushed his first home run in a Giants uniform, and it came against his former team, as he lifted San Francisco to a 3-2 victory over the Boston Red Sox. Landen Roupp picked up the win, striking out seven over six innings of work.
Ronald Acuna Jr. scored three runs and Drake Baldwin hit a home run as the Atlanta Braves decimated the Miami Marlins to tie the series.

Ian Happ’s two home runs and four RBIs lifted the Chicago Cubs to a 10-7 win over the Seattle Mariners. Cal Raleigh set a record for switch hitters in the loss, blasting his 30th home run before the all-star break.

The Washington Nationals combined for five home runs on the day, including two solo shots from Nathaniel Lowe, to cement a 7-3 win over the Los Angeles Dodgers. Jake Irvin picked up the win, striking out seven over five and a third innings.
Brandon Nimmo hit two solo shot home runs and Juan Soto mashed two homers while going four-for-five on the night with four RBIs as the New York Mets beat the Philadelphia Phillies 11-4.
Danny Jansen and Christopher Morel each had a home run and pitcher Ryan Pepiot recorded seven strikeouts to lift the Tampa Bay Rays over the Detroit Tigers.
The New York Yankees bats were hot hitting four home runs including ones from Ben Rice and J.C. Escarra who also combined for five RBIs as the Yankees beat the Baltimore Orioles 9-0.
Bo Bichette hit his 11th home run of the season before Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his 10th homer of the year as well to help power the Toronto Blue Jays past the Chicago White Sox 7-1.
